Fonda Lola.description: Known for its upscale take on traditional Mexican cuisine with a focus on fresh, local ingredients.

Casa Oaxaca.description: Specializes in Oaxacan cuisine, which is distinct for its complex moles and tlayudas (large, crispy tortillas with various toppings).

Alibertos.description: Casual Mexican eatery serving favorites including breakfast burritos, carne asada fries, and churros.

Spinasse.description: Elegant Italian dining with handmade pasta and regional dishes.

Serafina.description: Cozy trattoria serving classic Italian fare in a romantic setting.

Tavolata.description: Modern Italian eatery known for house-made pasta and communal dining.

Nirmal's.description: Upscale Indian restaurant known for modern takes on traditional dishes.

Taste of India.description: Casual spot serving classic Indian dishes, including vegetarian options.

Kathakali.description: Authentic South Indian cuisine specializing in Kerala-style dishes.

Petra Bistro.description: Jordanian & Mediterranean cuisine with a warm, inviting atmosphere.

Mamnoon.description: Lebanese and Syrian-inspired dishes with a modern twist.

Mediterranean Kitchen.description: Family-run restaurant known for generous portions and authentic flavors.

Museum of Pop Culture (MoPOP).description: Interactive museum featuring music, sci-fi, and pop culture exhibits.

Seattle Art Museum (SAM).description: Premier art museum showcasing global and contemporary works.

The Museum of Flight.address: 9404 E Marginal Way S, Seattle, WA 98108
The Museum of Flight.description: One of the largest air and space museums in the world.

Green Lake Park.address: 7201 E Green Lake Dr N, Seattle, WA 98115
Green Lake Park.description: A scenic park with a 2.8-mile trail around a beautiful lake, perfect for walking, biking, and picnics.

Discovery Park.description: The largest city park in Seattle, featuring breathtaking views, hiking trails, and a historic lighthouse.

Kerry Park.description: A small but famous viewpoint offering stunning panoramic views of the Seattle skyline.

Space Needle.description: One of Seattle's most iconic landmarks, offering breathtaking 360-degree views from the observation deck.

Pike Place Market.description: A historic market famous for fresh seafood, artisan crafts, and the first Starbucks store.

Snoqualmie.description: Snoqualmie Falls is a 268-foot waterfall located east of Seattle on the Snoqualmie River between Snoqualmie and Fall City, Washington

Climate Pledge Arena.description: Home to the Seattle Kraken, concerts, and major sports events, with a focus on sustainability.

T-Mobile Park.description: Home to the Seattle Mariners, offering baseball games, concerts, and special events.

Paramount Theatre.description: A historic venue hosting Broadway shows, concerts, and performing arts events.

Westlake Center.description: A downtown shopping mall with a mix of fashion, food, and access to the Seattle Monorail.

Northgate Station.description: A shopping and dining destination with a mix of retail stores and restaurants.

Pacific Place.description: An upscale shopping mall featuring designer brands, dining, and a movie theater.

Ballard Farmers Market.description: Year-round farmers market featuring local produce, meats, and crafts.

University District Farmers Market.description: A vibrant farmers market with fresh produce, local goods, and live music.
